meanings.definition: One that precedes or goes before in time
meanings.sent1: The foregoer of the parade led the way with a flag.
meanings.sent2: My grandfather is the foregoer of our family, setting an example for us all.
meanings.sent3: The foregoer of the race forgot to tie his shoelaces and tripped at the start.
meanings.sent4: The first snowflake was the foregoer of the winter storm to come.
meanings.sent5: The foregoer of the sunrise is the chirping of the early birds.

meanings.sent1: The foregoer of this ancient artifact must have been skilled.
meanings.sent2: Our foregoers worked hard to build the foundation of our community.
meanings.sent3: The foregoer of this recipe was probably a talented chef.
meanings.sent4: The foregoer of this tradition left a lasting legacy for us to follow.
meanings.sent5: Our foregoer's portrait hangs proudly in the town hall.

meanings.sent1: The foregoer of the storm was the darkening of the sky.
meanings.sent2: The foregoer of the trend was seen in the early adopters.
meanings.sent3: The foregoer of the new technology was a prototype that failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The foregoer of the concert was the sound of instruments tuning backstage.
meanings.sent5: The foregoer of the harvest season is the changing color of the leaves.
